interview.question: How excited are you to win your first Grand Slam?
interview.answer: Well, you know, I feel really great. I won doubles and singles. I'm first time here. Just the feeling is incredible.

interview.question: What was that whole experience like for you, going on Rod Laver Arena today?
interview.answer: Oh, yeah, it was great. I'm still 15 years old. I'm still young. I have time. But that experience, the crowd, you know, it's all a big thing. I just hope in the future I'm going to come back.

interview.question: Were you nervous today?
interview.answer: A bit. But I was just trying to focus on my game, you know, not to look at the crowd and other things. So, yeah.

interview.question: How did the match compare to the one you played at the Orange Bowl?
interview.answer: Well, you know, we played twice, so I know her well. I made a good tactic and I just use it, I guess.

interview.question: You're No.1 as of Monday. How does that make you feel?
interview.answer: Well, you know, it's great. I am younger than Taylor. She won last year doubles and singles also. So I'm just happy to be No.1.

interview.question: What are you going to do this year? Do you want to become world champion junior or you're going to play some WTA tournaments?
interview.answer: I'm going to play the junior Grand Slams: Roland Garros, Wimbledon, US Open. I'm just going to play 10,000's, 25's and 50's. I just want to go now for WTA ranking.

interview.question: Is it a goal to become world champion in juniors?
You had Iva Majoli there all week. What was that like for you?
interview.answer: It was great. She won Roland Garros, so she just give me some advices I can use in my game. She's just really nice to me. I just hope in the future we're going to get along.

interview.question: She was excited all through the week.
interview.answer: We are playing Fed Cup in two weeks. We'll just hang out in the few months now.

interview.question: What is that going to be like for you, playing Fed Cup?
interview.answer: No, it's another great experience. I'm going to get a chance to play with some pro players. I just happy to be there.

interview.question: How do you think you'll celebrate tonight?
interview.answer: Well, actually I have plane tonight. I'm going home. So it's going to take like two days to go home. At home I'm just going to spend some time with my family and friends to celebrate it.

interview.question: Have you had messages from home?
interview.answer: Yes, I just got right now. They're really happy for me. I'm just thankful for their support.

interview.question: If you play in Paris, will they come to Paris, do you think?
interview.answer: Yeah, I think so. My father and my sister's going to come. It's going to be a great experience for them.
